1.text: Paul, an apostle (sent neither by human commission nor from human authorities, but through Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised him from the dead),

2.text: and all the brethren who are with me, to the Churches of Galatia:

3.text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: who gave himself for our sins, so that he might rescue us from this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father—

5.text: to whom be the glory unto ages of ages! Amen.

6.text: I am amazed that you are so quickly deserting the one who called you in the grace of Christ in order to embrace a different “Good News”—

7.text: and there is no other “Good News!” Yet, there are some who disturb you and want to pervert the Good News of Christ.

8.text: Now even if we, or an angel from heaven, should preach to you any “Good News” that is not what we preached to you, let such a one be accursed!

9.text: We have said it before and now I say it again: if anyone preaches to you any other “Good News” than what you received, let such a one be accursed!

10.text: Am I now seeking to please God or people? Am I striving to please human beings? But if I were still trying to please men, then I would not be a bondservant of Christ!

11.text: [Regarding] the Good News which I preached, I proclaimed this to you, brethren, that it is not of human origin.

12.text: I did not receive it from man and I was not taught [this Good News] by man, but it came to me through a revelation of Jesus Christ.

13.text: You have heard about how I used to live in Judaism, how I persecuted the Church of God beyond measure, and how I ravaged it.

14.text: I advanced in the Jewish religion beyond many of my own age among my countrymen, as I was more extremely zealous for the traditions of my forefathers.

15.text: But when it was the good pleasure of God (who had set me apart from my mother’s womb and called me through his grace,

16.text: to reveal his Son in me so that I might preach him among the Gentiles), I did not immediately confer with flesh and blood:

17.text: I did not go up to Jerusalem to visit those who were apostles before me, but I went away into Arabia. Later on, I returned to Damascus.

18.text: Then, after three years, I did go up to Jerusalem to visit Peter, and I stayed with him for fifteen days.

19.text: However, I did not see any of the other apostles, except James, ‘the Lord’s brother.’

20.text: Now regarding the things which I write to you, you can see that I am not lying before God.

21.text: After that, I visited the districts of Syria and Cilicia.

22.text: My face was still unknown to the Churches of Judea which were in Christ;

23.text: they only heard, “The one who once persecuted us is now preaching the faith that he once tried to destroy!”

24.text: And they glorified God in me.
